walkthroughs.title: Getting started with Choreo
walkthroughs.description: Use the Choreo VSCode extension to speedup and empower your developer experience with Choreo projects. Refer to the Choreo panel on the left activity bar to conveniently access features.

steps.title: Open a project
steps.description:
Sign in to begin your developer experience with the Choreo VSCode extension. 
[Sign in](command:wso2.choreo.sign.in)
Once signed in, conveniently switch between your Choreo projects from the [Choreo activity panel](command:choreo.activity.project.focus). For projects that are not yet in your local environment, you can opt to clone the project to a location of your preference. 
[Open Project](command:wso2.choreo.project.open)

steps.title: Create a project
steps.description:
Create new projects, mono-repo and multi-repo, directly from the Choreo extension. Upon configuring basic project details and repository (for mono-repos), proceed to clone the project to your local environment. 
[Create new project](command:wso2.choreo.project.create)

steps.title: Create a component
steps.description:
Effortlessly create, sync, and push new components to Choreo from the VSCode extension. 
 **Create from existing** 
Create new components from existing. implementations by simply providing the source directory or the docker file. 
[Create Now](command:wso2.choreo.component.create?%22%7B%20mode%3A%20%27fromExisting%27%20%7D%22)
 **Create from scratch** 
Create new components from default templates available for Choreo users. 
[Create Now](command:wso2.choreo.component.create?%22%7B%20mode%3A%20%27fromScratch%27%20%7D%22)

steps.title: Visualize Choreo projects
steps.description:
Visualize different aspects of your Choreo projects for a range of valuable information, all from a single click. 
 **Architecture View** 
 A high-level view of your project components, their compositions, and their dependencies with one another and external endpoints. 
[Open Architecture View](command:ballerina.view.architectureView)
 **Cell View** 
 An enriched version of the architecture view, the cell view provides insights into the accessibility of your project components. 
[Open Cell View](command:ballerina.view.cellView)

steps.title: Publish your project
steps.description: To leverage the capabilities of Choreo, sync your local changes with Choreo.

scripts.build: pnpm run compile && pnpm run lint && pnpm run copy-webview-lib && pnpm run package && pnpm run postbuild
scripts.rebuild: pnpm run clean && pnpm run compile && pnpm run lint && pnpm run copy-webview-lib && pnpm run postbuild
scripts.extest-setup: npx extest get-vscode -c 1.81.0 && npx extest get-chromedriver -c 1.81.0 && npx extest install-vsix -f $(ls vsix/*.vsix) && npx extest install-vsix -f $(ls ../../ballerina-*.vsix)
scripts.e2e-test: pnpm run compile-tests && npx extest run-tests 'dist/src/tests/e2e-tests/*.test.js' --mocha_config src/tests/e2e-tests/.mocharc.js -o src/tests/e2e-tests/settings.json
scripts.e2e-playwright: pnpm run compile-tests && pnpm exec playwright test
scripts.integration-test: pnpm run compile-tests && npx extest run-tests 'dist/tests/integration-tests/*.test.js' --mocha_config src/tests/integration-tests/.mocharc.js -o src/tests/integration-tests/settings.json
scripts.pretest: pnpm run clean && pnpm run compile-tests && pnpm run lint && pnpm run copy-webview-lib
scripts.test: rm -rf .vscode-test/extensions && node ./dist/test/runTest.js && nyc report && nyc report --reporter=html
scripts.package: if [ $isPreRelease = true ]; then vsce package --no-dependencies --pre-release --baseImagesUrl https://github.com/wso2/choreo-vscode/raw/HEAD/; else vsce package --no-dependencies --baseImagesUrl https://github.com/wso2/choreo-vscode/raw/HEAD/; fi
